noun.description: A mark ( ¨ ) used over a vowel, as in German or Hungarian, to indicate a different vowel quality, usually fronting or rounding.

verb.description: Modify (a form or sound) by using an umlaut.
examples: the color of prothetic vowels, unless umlauted by the next syllable, was that of the laryngeal which was vocalized

origin: Mid 19th century: from German Umlaut, from um about + Laut sound.
